newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: IADB sees $800 mln loans to Colombia in 1997,1998.
newsitem.headline: IADB sees $800 mln loans to Colombia in 1997,1998.

text.p: The Inter-American Development Bank forecast it will make new loans of $800 million to Colombia in 1997 and 1998 in a press statement issued Friday.
The loans will chiefly be used to finance key projects in transport, education, regional development, energy and agriculture, the IADB bulletin said.

The figure announced after the end of a two-day visit to Colombia by Nancy Birdsall, vice-president of the IADB, represents a significant increase in current IADB loan levels to Colombia -- which stand at $155.5 million for 1996 to October 29.

Among the new loan packages to be agreed during 1997 and 1998 are likely to be a number destined to private sector infrastructure projects. The IADB approved its first loan of this type on October 30 this year to Termovalle for the construction of a thermo-electric generating plant in southwest Colombia.
During her visit to Colombia on November 12 and 13, Birdsall reiterated the IADB's commitment to supporting Colombia's economic development, the press release said.
